tit.cmt: Templeの後に（Yamatokoriyama City)を入れました。

sen.j: 久松寺（きゅうしょうじ）は、奈良県大和郡山市にある曹洞宗の寺院。
sen.e: Kyusho-ji Temple, located in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara prefecture, is a temple of the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.
Kyusho-ji Temple, located in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture, is a temple of the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.
sen.cmt: prefectureのPを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Kyusho-ji Temple, located in Yamatokoriyama City, Nara Prefecture, is a temple of the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.

sen.j: 山号は妙光山。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Myoko zan.
Its sango (name of a group of Buddhist temples) is Myoko zan.
sen.cmt: 山号の説明文を用語集に合わせて変更しました。
sen.e: Its sango (name of a group of Buddhist temples) is Myoko zan.

sen.j: 1987年の段階では廃寺であった。
sen.e: It had been closed by 1987.
As of 1987, it was closed.
sen.cmt: by 1987は文法的におかしいのでAs of に変更しました。
sen.e: As of 1987, it was closed.

sen.j: 本多家（忠義系統）の菩提寺。
sen.e: It is the ancestral temple of the Honda family (Tadayoshi line)
It is the ancestral temple of the Honda family (Tadayoshi line).
sen.cmt: 文の終わりにピリオドをつけました。
sen.e: It is the ancestral temple of the Honda family (Tadayoshi line).

sen.j: 曹洞宗の寺で、妙光山久松寺と称す。
sen.e: The temple of the Soto sect is called Myoko zan Kyusho-ji Temple.
The temple of the Soto sect is called Myoko zan Kyusho-ji Temple.
The temple of the Soto sect is called Myoko zan Kyusho-ji Temple.

sen.j: 元下野国足利郡毛野大久保村龍雲寺の末。
sen.e: Originally it was located at Ryoun-ji Temple no sue, Keno Okubomura Village Ashikaga County, Shimotsuke Province
sen.cmt: 「元」「末」の意味が不明ですが、元々は下野国足利郡毛野大久保村龍雲寺の末に所在していた、と訳してあります。
sen.e: Originally it was located at Ryoun-ji Temple no sue, Keno Okubomura Village, Ashikaga County, Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: Villageの後にコンマ、文の終わりにピリオドをつけました。
sen.e: Originally it was located at Ryoun-ji Temple no sue, Keno Okubomura Village, Ashikaga County, Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 由緒によれば開基は慶長元年(1596)5月28日、開基者は本多忠政公。
sen.e: According to the temple history, it was founded on May 28, 1596 by s Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)and its a founder (patron of a temple in its founding)wasTadamasa HONDA.
According to the temple history, it was founded on May 28, 1596 and the founder was Tadamasa HONDA.
sen.cmt: 開基はfoundの意味なので by s Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding）削除しました。Founderの前のits a をtheに変更しました。
sen.e: According to the temple history, it was founded on May 28, 1596 and the founder was Tadamasa HONDA.

sen.j: 本多忠政公の室、岡崎三郎信康息女熊姫《ユウ姫》また（国姫）（徳川家康、織田信長の孫姫）亡父の菩提の為建立。
sen.e: He founded it for salvation of Kumahime 《Yuhime》--a wife of Tadamasa HONDA and a daughter of Okazaki Saburo Nobuyasu -- (Kunihime) (granddaughter of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Nobunaga ODA), and his late father.

He founded it for salvation of Kumahime 《also referred to as Yuhime or Kunihime》 -- a wife of Tadamasa HONDA and a daughter of Saburo Nobuyasu OKAZAKI (granddaughter of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Nobunaga ODA) -- and her late father.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするために、語順を変更しました。また、OkazakiをOKAZAKIに変更しました。fatherは熊姫の父を指しているので、hisをherに変更しました。
sen.e: He founded it for salvation of Kumahime (also referred to as Yuhime or Kunihime) -- a wife of Tadamasa HONDA and a daughter of Saburo Nobuyasu OKAZAKI (granddaughter of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Nobunaga ODA) -- and her late father.

sen.j: 寛永3年(1626)6月25日、姫路城内にて熊姫逝去《妙光院快誉裕慶》。
sen.e: On June 25, 1626, Kumahime died in Himeji Castle 《Myoko-in Temple Kaiyo Yukei》
sen.cmt: 「妙光院快誉裕慶」読み方不明
sen.e: On June 25, 1626, Kumahime died in the Himeji Castle 《Myoko-in Temple Kaiyo Yukei》.
sen.cmt: 最後にピリオドをつけました。Himeji の前にtheを入れました。
sen.e: On June 25, 1626, Kumahime died in the Himeji Castle (Myoko-in Temple Kaiyo Yukei).

sen.j: 御前山で荼毘、姫路城下久松寺に葬される。
sen.e: Her body was cremated in Gozennyam and buried in Kyusho-ji Temple under the Himeji castle.
Her body was cremated in Mt. Gozen and buried in Kyusho-ji Temple near the Himeji Castle.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従って、GozennyamをMt.に変更しました。また、underをnearに変更しました。CastleのCを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Her body was cremated in Mt. Gozen and buried in Kyusho-ji Temple near the Himeji Castle.

sen.j: 久松寺、本多忠義に随伴す。
sen.e: Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied Tadayoshi HONDA
Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied Tadayoshi HONDA.
sen.cmt: 最後にピリオドをつけました。
sen.e: Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied Tadayoshi HONDA.

sen.j: 本多能登守忠義奥州白河入部に際して白河城下円妙寺町隋宝寺跡を久松寺と為し菩提寺とす。
sen.e: When Noto no kami (the governor of Noto Province), Tadayoshi HONDA, entered Oshu Shirakawa, he established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Zuiho-ji Temple in Enmyoji-cho under the Shirakawa castle.
When Noto no kami (the governor of Noto Province), Tadayoshi HONDA, entered Oshu Shirakawa, he established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Zuiho-ji Temple in Enmyoji-cho near the Shirakawa Castle.
sen.cmt: underをnearに変更しました。CastleのCを大文字にしました。
sen.e: When Noto no kami (the governor of Noto Province), Tadayoshi HONDA, entered Oshu Shirakawa, he established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Zuiho-ji Temple in Enmyoji-cho near the Shirakawa Castle.

sen.j: 延宝4年(1676)9月26日、本多忠義逝去。
sen.e: Tadayoshi HONDA died on September 26, 1676.
Tadayoshi HONDA died on September 26, 1676.
Tadayoshi HONDA died on September 26, 1676.

sen.j: 久松寺に葬される。
sen.e: His body was buried in Kyusho-ji Temple.
His body was buried in Kyusho-ji Temple.
His body was buried in Kyusho-ji Temple.

sen.j: 本多下野守忠平、宇都宮転封に伴い随伴（現・西原小学校）。
sen.e: When Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), Tadahira HONDA, was transferred to Utsunomiya, Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied him (to present-day Nishihara Elementary School).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), Tadahira HONDA, was transferred to Utsunomiya, Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied him (to present-day Nishihara Elementary School).
When Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province), Tadahira HONDA, was transferred to Utsunomiya, Kyusho-ji Temple accompanied him (to present-day Nishihara Elementary School).

sen.j: 貞享2年(1685) 本多忠平、大和郡山転封に伴い随従移転。
sen.e: In 1685, it accompanied Tadahira HONDA, when he was transferred to Yamato Koriyama.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1685, the temple was relocated in accord with the move of Tadahira HONDA to Yamatokoriyama.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に変更しました。大和郡山を一語にしました。
sen.e: In 1685, the temple was relocated in accord with the move of Tadahira HONDA to Yamatokoriyama.

sen.j: 城下南郡山円光院跡を久松寺と為す。
sen.e: He established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Enko-in Temple, Minami Koriyama under the castle.
He established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Enko-in Temple, Minami Koriyama near the castle.
He established Kyusho-ji Temple at the site of Enko-in Temple, Minami Koriyama near the castle.

sen.j: 分限帳によると寺領150石。
sen.e: Bugencho (Registers of vassals) says it had 150-koku of the temple estate.
According to Bugencho (Registers of vassals), the temple owned 150-koku of the temple estate.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に変更しました。
sen.e: According to Bugencho (Registers of vassals), the temple owned 150-koku of the temple estate.

sen.j: 享保8年(1723)12月本多家断絶。
sen.e: In 1723 the Honda family died out.
In 1723, the Honda family died out.
sen.cmt: 西暦の後にコンマを入れました。
sen.e: In 1723, the Honda family died out.

sen.j: 享保9年(1724)柳沢吉里郡山入部に伴い久松寺破却。
sen.e: In 1274 Kyusho-ji Temple was closed when Yoshisato YANAGISAWA was transferred to Koriyama.
In 1274, Kyusho-ji Temple was closed when Yoshisato YANAGISAWA was transferred to Koriyama.
sen.cmt: 西暦の後にコンマを入れました。
sen.e: In 1274, Kyusho-ji Temple was closed when Yoshisato YANAGISAWA was transferred to Koriyama.

sen.j: 元文2年（1737）矢田村城（現城町）に再興。
sen.e: In 1737 it was revived in Yadamrajo (present-day Shiro cho).
sen.cmt: 矢田村城、城町の読み不明
sen.e: In 1737, it was revived in Yadamurajo (present-day Shiro cho).
sen.cmt: 西暦の後にコンマを入れました。YadamrajoをYadamurajoに変更しました。
sen.e: In 1737, it was revived in Yadamurajo (present-day Shiro cho).

sen.j: 昭和9年室戸台風にて堂宇倒壊。
sen.e: In 1934 Muroto typhoon destroyed its temple building.
In 1934, Muroto typhoon destroyed the temple building.
sen.cmt: 西暦の後にコンマを入れました。Itsをtheに変更しました。
sen.e: In 1934, Muroto typhoon destroyed the temple building.

sen.j: 昭和62年、ふるさと歴史事典発刊に際し、誤って廃寺と表記。
sen.e: In 1987 it was described as closed in error in Furusato Rekishi Encyclopedia.
In 1987, it was described as closed in error in Furusato Rekishi Encyclopedia.
sen.cmt: 西暦の後にコンマを入れました。

sen.j: 平成20年、本堂再建。
sen.e: In 2008 its Hondo (main hall) was reconstructed.
In 2008, the hondo (main hall) was reconstructed.

sen.e: In 2008, the hondo (main hall) was reconstructed.

sen.j: 現存する本多家（忠義系統）唯一の菩提寺。

It is only existing ancestral temple of the Honda family (Takdayoshi line).
